summary: This is a forwarded email chain from June 2019 discussing scheduling a meeting about the Epstein case. The participants include a Chief of the Criminal Division for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and another individual, with the subject indicating the 'Epstein matter' is 'heating up'.

persons.name: Chief, Criminal Division United States Attorney's Office, SDNY
persons.context: The individual who initiated the request for a meeting to discuss the 'Epstein case', as indicated in the forwarded email.

events.title: Meeting Request for Epstein Case
events.description: The Chief of the Criminal Division for the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office requests a meeting to discuss the Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Chief, Criminal Division United States Attorney's Office, SDNY

events.title: Forwarded Discussion on Epstein Matter
events.description: An email is forwarded with the subject 'Epstein matter' and a note stating 'Issues heating up?', containing a chain discussing scheduling a meeting for the following week.
personsInvolved: Chief, Criminal Division United States Attorney's Office, SDNY

keyFacts: The email chain is from June 2019, indicating ongoing legal activity concerning the Epstein case at that time.
A high-ranking official, the Chief of the Criminal Division for the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office, was directly involved in scheduling a meeting about the case.
The subject line of the forwarded email includes the phrase 'Issues heating up?', suggesting the case was becoming more active or urgent.
The document shows coordination for a meeting, with one participant traveling in El Salvador.
